Preview of updated QMON icons (2)

Original toolbar

Updated toolbar



The following background colors are used in QMON with the icons.
Background 1              
Background 2              
Background 3              



The standard 32x32 pixels toolbar icons for the main window of qmon. A bigger version of these icons also exists (see below).
Toolbar
icon name		 Original Updated Comment Tango reference 
toolbar_job
Gridengine jobs are depicted as a document icon with a large gear on its left side. The job control icon is a gridengine document with an added magnifying glass in the bottom right. edit-find.svg 
toolbar_queue
Gridengine queues are represented by cylindric containers. The queue control icon is the grouping of 3 queues of different colors. battery.svg 
toolbar_submit
For the job submit icon, a yellow sparkle representing the action of creating has been put over a gridengine document icon. document-new.svg 
toolbar_cplx
The gear symbol characterizes complex resources and it is use for the complex configuration icon. emblem-system.svg 
toolbar_host
A single computer is used for the host configuration icon. computer.svg 
toolbar_cluster
Two computers and a server is used for the cluster configuration icon. network-workgroup.svg 
toolbar_sched
Scheduling and time being closely related, a clock with a countdown represents the scheduler icon. appointment-new.svg 
toolbar_calendar
A calendar is used to depict the calendar configuration. x-office-calendar.svg 
toolbar_user
The standard system users icon has been used for the user configuration icon. system-users.svg 
toolbar_pe
Two parallel lines are used to depict the parallel environment. format-text-italic.svg 
toolbar_ckpt
The action of saving to a disk is used for the checkpoint icon. document-save.svg 
toolbar_ticket
The yield symbol with an added exclamation mark is used for the policy icon. The purpose of the policy configuration is to determine the priority of jobs, so the yield symbol seems appropriate. dialog-warning.svg 
toolbar_prj
A presentation display is used for the project icon. x-office-presentation.svg 
toolbar_rqs
The resource quota icon is being depicted with green/red pie chart. x-office-presentation.svg 
toolbar_ar
The advance reservation icon is a gridengine document with a calendar+clock icon over it. The calendar+clock icon is later used for the 16x16 version of this icon. 
toolbar_browser
The same symbol of a magnifying glass has been kept for the browser icon. system-search.svg 
toolbar_exit
The exit icon is still represented with an open door icon. system-log-out.svg

The following icons are mostly used in the queue configuration panel.
Queue configuration
icon name		 Original Updated Comment Tango reference 
lock
A standard modern padlock is used for the close lock icon. system-lock-screen.svg 
open_lock
For the open lock icon, a standard padlock with its shackle open and fully turned is used. system-lock-screen.svg 
open_lock_insensitive
Gray disabled version of the open lock icon. system-lock-screen.svg 
trashcan
To keep with the environmental friendly trend the default trash icon is now a recycle icon. user-trash.svg 
aclask
The standard edit icon is used for the list editing buttons (ex: user list). edit-find-replace.svg 
peask
This icon is a copy of aclask icon. edit-find-replace.svg 
qask
This icon is a copy of aclask icon. edit-find-replace.svg

The following icons are use in the share tree policy windows found in the policy configuration panel.
Share tree policy window
icon name		 Original Updated Comment Tango reference 
head_open
This icon is most likely no longer used and obsolete. user-home.svg 
branch_open
An open folder represents the branch open icon in the policy tree. folder-open.svg 
branch
The branch close icon is represented by a closed folder. folder.svg 
leaf_open
A leaf is depicted by a simple document icon to go with the folder analogy. 
leaf
This icon is a copy of leaf_open. This icon is still being used, but there is no functionality related to it. 
leaf_minus
This icon is most likely no longer used and obsolete. 
leaf_plus
This icon is most likely no longer used and obsolete.

These icons are found within the time window which is used in several places to specify a duration or time. Except for the infinity symbol, these icons are used in combination with a word, making them redundant and useless. The have therefore been removed.
Time dialog window
icon name		 Original Updated Comment Tango reference 
days
Now a blank icon. 
hours
Now a blank icon. 
minutes
Now a blank icon. 
seconds
Now a blank icon. 
infinity
The infinity symbol was redone and off-centered toward the bottom so it aligns more properly with its corresponding button.

These icons are used to represent the complex resources and are mostly used in the queue configuration panel.
Complex ressources
icon name		 Original Updated Comment Tango reference 
bool
The boolean resource is represented with a true/false white/black icon. 
int
A simple '1' depicts an integer resource. By having one big number (instead of 3 small ones), it makes it easier to see this resource. 
cstr
A simple 'a' depicts the string resource (str). Again, having only one big letter makes this icon more distinguishable. 
str
An upper and lower case represent the case sensitive string resource (cstr). 
time
A clock represents the time resource. This icon is also used for time button icon. 
host
A computer is still used for the hostname resource. computer.svg 
mem
For the memory resource, a clearer top-down view of a chip is used instead of a 3D view. 
unknown
This icon is most likely never used. help-browser.svg 
double
none
An additional icon to depict double resources has been created. Currently, the integer icon is used for the double ressource and a code change is require to take advantage of this new icon.

The arrow icons can be found in the difference panel, but are mostly in the queue configuration panel.
Arrow
icon name		 Original Updated Comment Tango reference 
rightarrow
 
leftarrow
 
uparrow

These are all the icons used in the job submit panel.
Job submit
icon name		 Original Updated Comment Tango reference 
ar
The same calendar+clock used in the advance reservation toolbar button is reused for this icon. 
ckpt
This smaller checkpoint icon is the same as the toolbar checkpoint icon. document-save.svg 
ctx
This icon represents a contextual variable. The was no obvious choice, so the document+wrench icon has been used (this icon usually represents configuring/setting action) 
env
A tree is still used to represent the environment variables icon. 
penv
A smaller version of the parallel environment toolbar icon is reused for this icon. 
21cal
A small calendar icon is used for the calendar icon. office-calendar.svg 
21cal_ins
Gray disabled version of the previous icon. office-calendar.svg 
deadline
The deadline button is depicted by the interdiction road-sign. dialog-error.svg 
deadline_ins
Gray disabled version of the previous icon. dialog-error.svg 
mailbox
A simple envelope is used for the mail button. mail-reply-sender.svg 
mailbox_ins
Gray disabled version of the previous icon. mail-reply-sender.svg 
project
A smaller version of the project toolbar icon is reused for the project icon. x-office-presentation.svg 
project_ins
Gray disabled version of the previous icon. x-office-presentation.svg 
script_file
The standard executable script file icon is used for the script icon. text-x-script.svg 
script_file_ins
Gray disabled version of the previous icon. text-x-script.svg 
shell
A small shell prompt is used for the shell icon. utilities-terminal.svg 
shell_ins
Gray disabled version of the previous icon. utilities-terminal.svg 
stderror
The buttons for outputting IO to files were too abstract previously. A document icon with the words ERR/IN/OUT in it are now used so they won't confuse the user. 
stderror_ins
Gray disabled version of the previous icon. 
stdinput
See above. 
stdinput_ins
See above. 
stdoutput
See above. 
stdoutput_ins
See above. 
resources_enabled
The ressource requirement button is now depicted using a set of gears to go with the complex icon. A cross or check-mark in the icons now clearly describes if a ressource has been allocated or not. emblem-system.svg 
resources
See above. emblem-system.svg 
qsh_off
For the batch mode icon, a cross is added beside the monitor to indicate the lack of interaction with the job by the user. computer.svg 
qsh_off_ins
Gray disables version of the previous icon. This icon is most likely obsolete. computer.svg 
qsh_on
For the interactive icon, a monitor is used to represent the interaction with the job by the user. computer.svg 
qsh_on_ins
Gray disables version of the previous icon. This icon is most likely obsolete. computer.svg 
binary_off
For the script job icon, as before, a standard document with lines icon is used. 
binary_off_ins
Gray disabled version of the previous icon. 
binary_on
For the binary job icon, a document icon with 0+1 in it is used. 
binary_on_ins
Gray disabled version of the previous icon. This icon is most likely obsolete.

Misceallenous
icon name		 Original Updated Comment Tango reference 
memorybig
This icon is used in the ressource dialog box for entering the memory value. This icon was removed because it's redundant and unhelpful. 
file_link
The file link is best represented with a common link icon. 
peconf
This icon is identical with the toolbar_pe icon.

The terminal icons don't seem to be used anymore. They represent different OS platform running gridengine commands. Some supported platforms are missing (ex: MacOS, Windows) while others are no longer supported (ex: Sgi, Axp, Cray, Dec).
Terminal
icon name		 Original Updated Comment Tango reference 
xterm-blank
The blank icon is represented with a terminal (monitor + box) 
xterm-axp
AXP (later renamed Digital Unix) was an OS for DEC workstations (circa 1992-1995). 
xterm-cray
The Cray OS icon is represented with the Cray logo. 
xterm-dec
The DEC icon actually has the Compaq logo in it. This icon probably represents Tru64 OS for the DEC AlphaServer. 
xterm-hp
The HP logo is used for the HP-UX OS icon. 
xterm-ibm
The original icon is not readable, but it probably represents IBM AIX OS. 
xterm-linux
Tux for the Linux OS icon. 
xterm-sgi1
The Irix OS is represented with an old SGI icon. 
xterm-sgi
A second SGI icon exists, which is similar to the previous icon but with a different color. 
xterm-sol
Solaris OS is represented with the latest Solaris logo. 
xterm-sun
The old SunOS platform is depicted with the Sun logo. 
xterm
The standard X logo is used for the X icon.

The following are the BIG 64x64 pixels versions of the toolbar icons. With this version of the icons, you can better appreciate the original artwork which was horribly downsized to create the default 32x32 icons. These 64x64 icons are not available in the standard grid engine. To use them, you need to compile qmon with a modified Makefile. The 64x64 icons reused the 32x32 pixels versions to which I've added the official tooltip title (minus the word configuration). Some of the original titles were incorrectly named.

The introduction logo was updated to remove the old website link.
Icon name Original 
intro
intro-sge
